byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and SCOTT SHANE

abstract: Obama administration says that it believes airstrikes conducted outside of conventional war zones have killed 64 to 116 civilian bystanders and around 2,500 terrorist group members; official count is far below estimates made by independent organizations; Pres Obama also issues executive order prioritizing civilian protection and requiring government in future to disclose number of civilian deaths every year.
snippet: About 64 to 116 civilians and about 2,500 members of terrorist groups have died in American airstrikes, the Obama administration said, hundreds lower than independent estimates....

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: About 64 to 116 civilians and about 2,500 members of terrorist groups have died in American airstrikes, the Obama administration said, hundreds lower than independent estimates.

headline.main: U.S. Reveals Death Toll From Airstrikes Outside War Zones
headline.print_headline: U.S. Makes Public the Death Toll From Airstrikes
